etymology.description: Depicts a wheat plant with an ear, leaves, stem, and roots
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicting a wheat plant, 來(來) (lái, 'come') was borrowed for the meaning 'to come'. This usage possibly reflects the significance of wheat in ancient cultures or its introduction to the area, leading to its association with arrival or coming forth.

examples.chinese: 我想你来这儿(我想你來這兒)。
examples.english: I want you to come here.

examples.chinese: 请马上来这儿(請馬上來這兒)。
